intro: Pteroptychia inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal pteroptychia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its daisy-like flowers, which consist of a central disk surrounded by ray florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats, such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. The species is native to parts of southern Africa, where it thrives in regions with seasonal rainfall.
